{

  ,

    "value": true,

  ,
  "disposition":
    "value": false,
    "reason": "Disposition describes the state or position of an object but does not distinctly characterize what a sandwich is since sandwiches can be found in various states (e.g., fresh, stale) without changing their essence as a food item."
  ,
  "function":
    "value": true,
    "reason": "Function is universally relevant as it helps understand the purpose or role an object serves, which for a sandwich includes its intended consumption as food."
  ,
  "size":
    "value": true,
    "reason": "Size matters in characterizing a sandwich since how big or small can indicate how much filling and bread are used, making size a relevant descriptor."
  ,
  "weight":
    "value": true,
    "reason": "Weight is also universally relevant as it contributes to understanding the physical properties of an object, which includes food items like sandwiches."
  ,
  "temperature":
    "value": false,
    "reason": "While temperature can be a property for some foods and objects, for a sandwich itself, its inherent characteristics are not defined by or dependent on its temperature. Temperature is more about the state of consumption (hot vs cold) than the defining properties of what makes it a sandwich."
